repetitions.exitCondition: Completion of 152 weeks or discontinuation due to lack of 20% improvement in TJC/SJC at 2 consecutive visits starting at Week 36

repetitions.sourceText: Matching placebo for upadacitinib (ABT-494) Dose: 1 tablet once daily
Blood samples for assay of upadacitinib and possibly other medications in plasma will be collected at each visit after baseline in Period 1.

Safety evaluations include adverse event (AE) monitoring, physical examinations, vital sign measurements, electrocardiogram (ECG), and clinical laboratory testing (hematology, chemistry, and urinalysis) as a measure of safety and tolerability for the entire study duration.

traversalConstraints.sourceText: [{'condition': 'Subjects assigned to placebo at baseline', 'path': ['PLACEBO_W0_TO_W24', 'UPADACITINIB_W24_TO_W56']}, {'condition': 'Premature discontinuation of study drug', 'path': ['DISCONTINUATION_VISIT', '30_DAY_FOLLOW_UP']}, {'condition': 'State of emergency or pandemic', 'path': ['PHONE_OR_VIDEO_CONFERENCE_VISITS', 'REMOTE_VITAL_SIGNS', 'DELAYED_PHYSICAL_EXAM_OR_CXR']}]

executionTypes.activityId: Upadacitinib 30 mg to 15 mg Dose Switch
executionTypes.rationale: Conditional workflow requiring subjects currently on 30 mg to switch to 15 mg at their next scheduled visit upon approval of the amendment.
A one-time assessment to be completed preferably prior to initiation of another therapy upon study withdrawal.
Scheduled assessments performed at study visits, with flexibility for phone/video or caregiver performance during emergencies.
Scheduled assessments to be performed at specific visits, with instructions to defer to the next feasible visit if interrupted.
Assessments performed on an annual basis throughout the study duration.
Conditional workflow triggered only if a subject has seroconversion on an annual TB test without risk factors.
Standard scheduled monitoring, with provision for local lab use during state of emergency/pandemic.

endpointAlgorithms.name: Primary: ACR20 response at Week 12
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: >= 20% improvement in TJC AND >= 20% improvement in SJC AND >= 20% improvement in 3 of the 5 remaining measures (Pain, PtGA, PGA, HAQ-DI, or hs-CRP)
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Proportion of subjects achieving ACR20 response
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The primary efficacy endpoint is the proportion of subjects achieving ACR20 response at Week 12. ACR20/50/70 response rates will be determined based on 20%/50%/70% or greater improvement in TJC and SJ

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Change from baseline in HAQ-DI at Week 12
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Change from baseline in HAQ-DI at Week 12

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: sIGA of Psoriasis 0 or 1
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Score of 0 or 1 and at least a 2-point improvement from baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Static Investigator Global Assessment (sIGA) of Psoriasis of 0 or 1 and at least a 2-point improvement from baseline at Week 16

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: PASI 75 response at Week 16
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: >= 75% reduction in PASI score for subjects with >= 3% BSA psoriasis at baseline
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Psoriasis Area Severity Index (PASI) 75 response at Week 16 (for subjects with ≥ 3% BSA psoriasis at baseline)

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Minimal Disease Activity (MDA) at Week 24
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: Count of (TJC <= 1, SJC <= 1, PASI <= 1 OR BSA-Ps <= 3%, Pain <= 1.5, PtGA <= 2, HAQ-DI <= 0.5, Entheseal points <= 1) >= 5
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: The proportion of subjects achieving MDA will be determined based on subjects fulfilling 5 of 7 outcome measures: TJC ≤ 1; SJC ≤ 1; PASI ≤ 1 or BSA-Ps ≤ 3%; patient assessment of pain ≤ 1.5 (0 – 10 NR

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: ACR20 response at Week 2
endpointAlgorithms.algorithm: >= 20% improvement in TJC AND >= 20% improvement in SJC AND >= 20% improvement in 3 of the 5 remaining measures
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Proportion of subjects achieving ACR20 response

endpointAlgorithms.name: Secondary: Clinically meaningful improvement in HAQ-DI
endpointAlgorithms.successCriteria: Reduction in HAQ-DI score of 0.35 or greater
endpointAlgorithms.sourceText: Proportion of subjects achieving a clinically meaningful improvement in HAQ-DI (≥ 0.35).

derivedVariables.name: ACR20 Response
derivedVariables.derivationRule: 20% or greater improvement in TJC and SJC AND 20% or greater improvement in at least 3 of the 5 remaining measures (Pain, PtGA, PGA, HAQ-DI, or hs-CRP).
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: Change from baseline in HAQ-DI
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: sIGA Response
derivedVariables.derivationRule: sIGA score of 0 or 1 AND at least a 2-point improvement from baseline
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: PASI 75 Response
derivedVariables.derivationRule: At least 75% reduction from baseline in PASI score; only for subjects with >= 3% BSA psoriasis at baseline
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: Minimal Disease Activity (MDA)
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Fulfilling 5 of 7 outcome measures: TJC <= 1; SJC <= 1; PASI <= 1 or BSA-Ps <= 3%; Pain <= 1.5; PtGA <= 2; HAQ-DI <= 0.5; Tender entheseal points <= 1
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: Clinically meaningful improvement in HAQ-DI
derivedVariables.derivationRule: Decrease from baseline in HAQ-DI score >= 0.35
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

derivedVariables.name: Morning stiffness
derivedVariables.baselineDefinition: Last non-missing value prior to first dose

transitions.trigger: Progress to Period 2 Long Term Extension

doseLevels.description: Optimal dose for patients with active psoriatic arthritis and proposed dose for marketing authorization.
Previous dose in Period 2; subjects switched to 15 mg QD upon approval of Amendment 8.

doseModifications: Subjects currently on upadacitinib 30 mg QD are switched to upadacitinib 15 mg QD in Period 2 upon approval of protocol amendment 8.
Guidelines for interruption of study drug in subjects with signs/symptoms or suspicion of COVID-19 infection.
Specific Toxicity Management Guidelines for Abnormal Laboratory Values (e.g., AST/ALT > 8 x ULN).

visitWindows.sourceText: The study duration will include a 35-day screening period; a 56-week blinded period which includes 24 weeks of double-blind, placebo-controlled treatment followed by 32 weeks of treatment blinded to t
To compare the safety and tolerability of upadacitinib 15 mg QD and 30 mg QD versus placebo in subjects with moderately to severely active PsA who have an inadequate response to bDMARDs. Period 2

Subjects who were assigned to placebo at baseline will be preassigned to receiving either upadacitinib 15 mg QD or upadacitinib 30 mg QD starting at Week 24 in a 1:1 ratio. Subjects who complete the W

in either or both tender joint count (TJC) and swollen joint count (SJC) at both Week 12 and Week 16) will add or modify background therapy for PsA. At Week 24, all subjects allocated to placebo at Ba

At Week 16, subjects classified as non-responders (defined as not achieving at least 20% improvement in either or both tender joint count (TJC) and swollen joint count (SJC) at both Week 12 and Week 1

Week 56 visit (end of Period 1) will enter the long-term extension portion of the study, Period 2 (total study duration up to approximately 3 years). Subjects will continue study treatment as assigned

The last dose of oral study drug is taken the day prior to the Week 152 visit. Upon approval of protocol amendment 8, subjects receiving upadacitinib 30 mg QD will be switched to upadacitinib 15 mg QD
